intro: Jasione scabiosae-capitata, commonly known as the scabious bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Native to southern Europe, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun conditions. It is often found in grasslands, woodland edges, and rocky habitats, where it plays a role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
